author: @breydonb
text: If you're trying to do this nowadays, you will need to get your data from elsewhere. Sentdex also has excellent videos on a module/API called Quandl. Quandl publishes EOD stock data, investor sentiment, and tons of other stuff. Much of the data available through Quandl is premium (not free), but there is also tons of free data on there to play with.  https://docs.quandl.com/docs/installation-1  Also, if you're trying to use urllib2 with Python 3, note that it was split into a few different modules, so the way now to be able to call urlopen is "from urllib2.request import urlopen."

author: @juangoncalvesp
text: Take into consideration that Yahoo finance data is no longer available  From a Yahoo staffer here - https://forums.yahoo.net/t5/Yahoo-Finance-help/Is-Yahoo-Finance-API-broken/td-p/250503/page/3  "Hi All - This feature was discontinued by the Finance team and they will not be reintroducing that functionality. "

author: @sentdex
text: Use python 2.7. You can have both versions on your system. This series and all my videos are done using python 2.7. Py 2.7 is much more documented and has way more modules, which is why many people choose it over 3+.
